material.mattext: Which of the following is true?
The probability that the two chosen are of the same gender is equal to the probability that the two chosen are not of the same gender.
The probability that the two chosen are of the same gender is exactly half of the probability that the two chosen are not of the same gender.
The probability that the two chosen are of the same gender is exactly twice the probability that the two chosen are not of the same gender.

Incorrect. Note that in four of the 12 outcomes the two chosen are of the same gender, and in eight outcomes they are not. Therefore:
P(same gender) = 4/12 and P(not the same gender) = 8/12.

Good Job! In four of the 12 outcomes the two chosen are of the same gender, and in eight outcomes they are not. Therefore:
P(same gender) = 4/12 which is exactly half of P(not the same gender) = 8/12.

Incorrect. Note that in four of the 12 outcomes the two chosen are of the same gender, and in eight outcomes they are not. Therefore:
P(same gender) = 4/12 which is actually smaller than P(not the same gender) = 8/12.
